args:
As the group pursues Laxi, Mascula informs
them of his history. While the androids' creator,
Maestro, gave Laxi absolute command over
the other units, he granted Mascula the power
to destroy Laxi utterly. And as a final gesture,
he gave both of them a heart.
Laxi is 1,920 steps from this point.\nWe must hurry!
Are all androids so precise with\ntheir measurements?
...Laxi and I are special.\nWe were unique designs.
Say, Mascula. You guys are all weapons\nmade for fighting, yeah?
I don't mind. It's the truth, after all.\nWe are indeed weapons.
But you only seem to want peace.\nIs that why you say you're unique?
Might I take a moment to\ntell you of our past?
We androids were created by the\nDyrenell Empire 300 years ago.
However, our creator, Maestro,\ndid not actually wish to do so.
He didn't want to create you?
Right. Maestro was of Dyrenell, but he\nobeyed the Empire not out of choice.
He often said that in truth, he had no\ndesire to make weapons of war.
So this Maestro guy is like your dad\nor something?
Man, I can't even imagine knowing your\nown dad didn't want to make you.\nTalk about a total downer!
Not at all. I was happy to have been made\nby Maestro.
He never treated us as weapons.
He hated sending us into battle,\nso much so that he defied the Empire's\norders to do so time and again.
That would explain why I almost never\nsaw an android, despite hearing almost\nnonstop rumors about them.
Some who fought the Empire back then\neven considered them a fiction dreamed\nup to instill fear in our hearts.
But he was an organic being with\na finite amount of time to live.
Yes. He was taken by illness\nbefore the conflict could end between\nthe Dyrenell Empire and Alberius.
However, he left behind fail-safes to\nensure someone could not force us\nto fight after his death.
First, he designed androids to prioritize\nLaxi's orders above all others—even the\nwielder of the control element.
Secondly, he ensured that if Laxi were to\never cease functioning, all other androids\nwould immediately do so as well.
Finally, he created one final android\nwith the power to annihilate Laxi.
So this whole time there's been someone\nwho can stop Laxi's mad rampage?\nWho is this magic android?!
Waaaait a second. Aren't you a big hippie\nwho totally hates fighting?
Yes, why would the power to stop Laxi\nbe given to one who is clearly so loath\nto use it when necessary?
I suspect that to be the exact reason.

There was one final fail-safe that Maestro
left in place: Unlike all other androids,
Laxi and I have both been gifted with
a heart.

As in a large muscle that pumps blood?
No. Maestro gave us the capacity to judge
right from wrong. This is what I call our
＂heart.＂
And right now, Laxi's heart is damaged.
That must be why she's attacking everyone\nindiscriminately.
This functionality is also responsible for\nmy disdain for fighting.
If I destroy Laxi, all androids will cease\nto function. It is a decision with heavy\nconsequences to say the least.
I suspect Maestro gave me a heart so\nI would not wield this ability without\ngiving it all due consideration.
Your Maestro sounds like a kind man.

Perhaps he gave you hearts not as 
a fail-safe, but just because he wanted
his own children to have kind hearts
themselves.
You think he thought of us as his children?
And that means he didn't give you a\nheart just to connect the dots in some\nkind of weird grand plan.
He did it so you could become a kind\nperson, just as he was.
Perhaps it occurred to you because you\nshare the same kindness Maestro had.
Thankfully, after his death, people\nmanaged to seal the Other away.
We androids went to sleep, and Maestro's\nfail-safes were never needed.
I expected we would remain dormant\nuntil the end of time.
But 300 years later, I was awakened and\nmet all of you. I cannot believe this to be\ncoincidence.
I fear the time to use the fail-safe\nimplanted in me may finally be upon us.
